Ask: Who are you? What is your job title? What is your main role? Are you working on design of a government service, and if so which one?

The top 28 services account for over 90% of transactions

Register to vote, renew a patent, apply for rural payments, book a prison visit, find an apprenticeship, apply for redundancy payment, create a lasting power of attorney, claim carer’s allowance, apply for a visa…
How do you simultaneously design 25 services for the same website?
How do you do design at scale?
There are more people designing GOV.UK outside GDS than inside GDS

Make groups to work on a question you want to answer

Design patterns can’t be imposed on people
Design patterns can’t negotiate with the business
Design patterns save time because you don't have to keep answering the same question
Design patterns can help to provide consistency for users
Design patterns help to provide known answers to common problems
Design patterns help to provide a focus for the community
What would we do differently if we started again?
If you're starting your own design patterns...
